Both furnaces have coal fuel but no ingredients

### Copper Processing Complex at (20, 20)
- Burner mining drill at (20.0, 20.0) for copper ore extraction
- Wooden chest at (20.5, 21.5) containing 203 copper ore
- Stone furnace at (24.0, 20.0) for smelting
- Wooden chest at (24.5, 17.5) containing 51 copper plates
- Multiple inserters creating an automation chain:
  - Burner inserter at (19.5, 21.5) moving items to storage chest
  - Burner inserter at (21.5, 21.5) for intermediate transfer
  - Burner inserter at (22.5, 20.5) feeding the furnace
  - Burner inserter at (24.5, 18.5) moving finished plates to storage

# ERROR TIPS

### Transport Belt Placement Errors
- Ensure there is clear space before attempting to place transport belts
- Check for any entities (including inserters) that might be blocking the belt path
- When creating belt paths between inserters, verify that the entire path is free of obstacles

### Entity Connection Issues
- When connecting entities with transport belts, ensure the path is properly planned and clear
- Consider the orientation and position of inserters relative to the planned belt path
- Make sure the source and target positions for belt connections are valid and accessible

### Space Management
- Plan the layout of structures with enough space between components to accommodate transport belts and inserters
- Leave adequate space for future expansions and connections between different parts of the factory
